content.1: (100x50) - Recortar desde el centro a la caja de visualización WxH
content.2: (100x50t) - Recortar desde arriba a la caja de visualización WxH
content.3: (100x50b) - Recortar desde abajo a la caja de visualización WxH
content.4: (100x50f) - Sin recorte, se ajusta dentro de la caja de visualización WxH
content.5: (0x50) - ajustar a la altura H, manteniendo la relación de aspecto
content.6: (100x0) - redimensionar al ancho W, manteniendo la relación de aspecto

cascadeDelete.name: Eliminación en cascada
cascadeDelete.tip: Al eliminar "{ tableName }" registros de tabla, los registros con corresponding IDs in the associated multiple tables también serán eliminados. In the case of multiple associations, the cascade delete operation will only be performed when all data in the related data table has been removed.

content.1: After configuration, additional access authentication will be performed, which will be executed before all authentication methods.
content.2: For example, to allow only verified users to authenticate, you can set it to "verified = true"
content.3: Leave blank to allow any user to authenticate

picker.name: Select the "{ tableName }" table data to be associated

content.1: No matching data found
Returns all data in the "{ tableName }" table, and supports paging query, sorting and filtering
Query a "{ tableName }" table data based on ID
Add a new "{ tableName }" table data
Update a "{ tableName }" table data based on ID
Delete a piece of "{ tableName }" table data based on ID
Subscribe to real-time changes to the "{ tableName }" table via Server Sent Events (SSE)

batchApi.name: Unified addition, deletion, modification and query/POST

content.1: Implemented in a single request: create/update/modify/delete multiple "{ tableName }" table records, and support batch processing and transactions
Query the list of "identity authorization methods" supported by the server
Use email or other fields to combine the password and finally initiate a verification authorization request
Authenticates using an OAuth2 provider and returns a new authentication token and record data
Authenticate using one-time password (OTP)
Create a new authorization token for an already authorized data request
Verify that the user account is valid, for example by sending an email
Send a user password reset request, for example by sending an email
If the user changes the account email address by himself, he needs to verify it through this interface, for example, by sending an email.
The following record fields are available
content.2: The fields allowed to be requested can be limited by a special filter @request
content.3: You can also use the @collection filter to add constraints and query other data table contents

content.1: Bienvenido a BosBase

proxy.title: Obtener la IP real del cliente
proxy.curIp: Se detectó que su IP actual es
proxy.trustedHeaders: El identificador IP del encabezado de solicitud en el que confiar

content.1: When BosBase is deployed on a platform such as Fly, or accessed through a proxy such as NGINX, requests from different users will come from the same IP address (i.e. the IP of the proxy connected to your BosBase application)
content.2: In this case, to get the actual user IP (for rate limiting, logging, etc.) you need to configure your proxy correctly and list the following trusted headers that BosBase can use to extract the user IP
content.3: When using such proxies, to prevent spoofing, it is recommended
content.4: Use headers that can only be controlled by the proxy and cannot be set manually by the user
content.5: Make sure the BosBase server is only accessible through a proxy
content.6: If BosBase is not deployed behind a proxy, you can clear the header information fields
content.7: Separate with half-width commas to configure multiple, single such as

tip.1: Configured proxy headers do not match detected ones
tip.2: In some cases, a proxy server may return multiple IP addresses in the HTTP header. Typically these IP addresses are arranged in order from farthest to nearest. In this case, the rightmost IP address is usually that of the client. The actual IP address is therefore considered the most reliable or "more trustworthy". However, this is not a hard and fast rule as different proxy servers may have different implementations.
tip.3: The IP on the far left
tip.4: The IP on the far right
tip.5: If what is displayed is not the actual IP of your current client, it means you need to configure an available proxy for the server.
tip.6: Proxy header detected, recommended to be listed as trusted!

content.1: Rate limit label format
content.2: Rate limiting rules are parsed in the following order (stopping on first match)
content.3: If multiple rules have the same label but target different user audiences (e.g. 'guest' vs. 'auth'), only the matching audience rule will be considered
content.4: Rate limit labels can be in one of the following formats:

action.hideEditControl: Hidden data creation and editing entrance

smtp.title: SMTP configuration

content.1: When closed, BosBase will use the unix "sendmail" command to send emails (this function is no longer available). In order to ensure that emails are sent, please also configure the SMTP mail server yourself.
content.2: Some SMTP servers, such as Gmail SMTP-relay, require an appropriate domain name in the initial EHLO/HELO exchange to identify the server sending the mail. Using 'localhost' or an invalid domain name may cause the SMTP server to refuse the connection, as they usually require authentication. Server for sending mail to prevent abuse and spam
content.8: Email sent successfully! If you don't receive it, please check your spam folder. It may be that the recipient's email address is filled in by someone else.
content.9: The email sending times out, possibly because the network between the server and the SMTP server is not smooth.

smtp.ehloOrHeloDomain: Domain name provided to the mail server for verification (EHLO/HELO)

content.1: When not enabled, all file upload interfaces will use local hard disk storage, so you can enable and configure S3 storage and store subsequent files in S3 storage.
content.2: If files uploaded by users exist locally, please manually transfer them to the new object storage
content.3: There are many command line tools that can help you, such as:
content.4: This instance runs in PostgreSQL-backed multi-node mode so local file storage is disabled. Keep S3 enabled and configured.

backup.maxBackupFilesNum: Maximum number of backup files to retain

content.1: Data backup & recovery
content.3: Please note that during the backup, other concurrent write requests may fail because the database will be temporarily 'locked' (usually happens during ZIP generation)
content.4: If you are using S3 storage to upload collection files, you will need to back them up separately as they are not stored locally and will not be included in the final backup!
content.5: The input content needs to carry the “.zip” suffix, and the name can only contain numbers, English, underscores, and minus signs.
content.8: Backup recovery is experimental and only works on UNIX-based operating systems!
content.9: Please proceed with caution, it is recommended to manually save some historical backup files to your other storage
content.10: The current operation will overwrite the contents of the "pb_data" directory on the server side, and the application process will be automatically restarted after the operation is completed.
content.11: This means that once successful, all your current data (including data table contents, users, super users, etc.) will be completely overwritten by the new data
content.12: If the backup file is invalid or incompatible, it will eventually be rolled back without data loss (e.g. "data.db" data)
content.13: Please enter the current backup file name to confirm the operation
content.17: The first day of each month: 00:00
content.18: URL format used to access S3 buckets and objects. When turned on, the bucket name is included in the path part of the URL rather than as part of the domain name. Por ejemplo "https://s3.amazonaws.com/BUCKET/KEY" instead of the default "https://BUCKET.s3.amazonaws.com/KEY"

action.backupToS3: Automatically upload backup files to S3 storage
